description.value: If set to true, it means that the system displaying the form (or the individual encoding the form for data capture) can choose to omit the item from display to the user.

purpose.value: Some "complex" questionnaires may have questions, sections or groups which are "non-essential" and can be safely skipped without a need for the user to even see them. This is distinct from questions that do not need to be answered, but which must be shown to the user and the user must consciously choose to skip.

short.value: Can suppress from display to user

definition.value: If set to true, it means that the system displaying the form (or the individual encoding the form for data capture) can choose to omit the item from display to the user.

comment.value: If a group or question that contains other groups or questions is marked as "optional", all of its contents are automatically also treated as optional.
